Description: Ashland Inc. was sentenced to pay a criminal fine of $1.5 million and $11.55 million in other payments in connection with a massive 1997 explosion at the company's St. Paul Park refinerythat injured several people.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2002/December/02_crm_741.htm

Description: The United States and Hercules, Inc. entered into an agreement whereby Hercules, Inc. agreed to pay a stipulated penalty of $2 million for alleged violations of a 1992 consent decree associated with the Resin Disposal Site in Pennsylvania.
Info Source: http://www2.epa.gov/enforcement/case-summary-2-million-stipulated-penalties-related-violation-cleanup-settlement-resin

Description: EPA and Hercules Incorporated (Hercules) agreed to an order on consent under section 3008(h) of the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act regarding the Hercules facility in Hattiesburg, Miss. to conduct cleanup work valued at $1 million to address on and off-site contamination.
Info Source: http://www2.epa.gov/enforcement/case-summary-hercules-agrees-1-million-cleanup-its-hattiesburg-miss-facility

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the U.S. Department of Justice announced that Hercules Incorporated has agreed to pay a $175,000 penalty to settle alleged violations of federal environmental laws in the processing of cellulose fiber at its Hopewell, Va., plant.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/646fb8b44f127be785257a4c006e8941.html
https://www.fra.dot.gov/eLib/details/L01494#p1_z5_gD_lEA

Description: Hercules, Inc., a Wilmington, Del., chemical company, has agreed to pay a $245,521 civil penalty to the United States for violating the Clean Air Act's Leak Detection and Repair requirements at its manufacturing facility in Louisiana, Mo.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/73fac3d2f31b9abd85257905005e7de8.html
